This request retrieves the list of standups from the collection.

This request creates a standup, and this document is inserted to the collection (table).

**Optional fields:**

*   **In "standup" body, "reminders" field;**
    *   days
        *   The days in the week to send out reminders. This is specified in the "reminders" field in "standup" body. **By default** **not specified will be Mon - Fri**.
        *   For example :
            *   `"days": [1, 3, 4, 7]`
            *   This sends reminder at every week's Mon, Wed, Thur and Sun.
    *   staticTime
        *   To state whether to have reminders send out conformed to each user's timezone or based off the UTC time. **By default** **not specified will be false**.
        *   For example
            *   `"staticTime": true`
                *   If there's a reminder scheduled at 2 p.m. for this standup, it will be sent out at 2 p.m. to each user according to their timezone.
            *   `"staticTime": false`
                *   If there's a reminder scheduled at 2 p.m. for this standup, it will be sent out at 2 p.m following the UTC time to all users associated with this standup.
    *   schedules
        *   Only up to 3 reminders can be scheduled per standup. **By default** **not specified means no reminders will be scheduled** **for the current standup**.
        *   Passing in the form of `{"schedules": [{"time": {"hour": , "min": }}]}` means to set a new reminder.
        *   Params:
            *   "schedules" -
                *   "hour" - number, `0 - 23`
                *   "min" - number, `0 - 59`
        *   For example;
            *   `"reminders": {"schedules": [{"time": {"hour": 9, "min": 45}}]}`
                *   This specifies to schedule a reminder at 9:45 a.m.
            *   `"reminders": {"schedules": [{"time": {"hour": 10, "min": 45}}, {"time": {"hour": 14, "min": 45}}]}`
                *   This specifies to schedule reminders at 10:45 a.m. and 2 p.m at UTC time.

``` json
{
    "standup": {
        ...
        "reminders": {
            "staticTime": false,
            "days": [1, 3, 4, 7],
            "schedules": [
                {"time": {"hour": 10, "min": 45}},
                {"time": {"hour": 14, "min": 45}}
            ]
        }
    }
}

```

item.name: Update Standup with no additional options

request.description:
This request updates a particular standup by replacing the whole document with the request body specified.

**Optional fields:**

*   **In "standup" body, "reminders" field;**
    *   days
        *   The days in the week to send out reminders. This is specified in the "reminders" field in "standup" body. **By default** **not specified means it will not be updated and still hold the previous value**.
        *   For example :
            *   If before updating standup, the`"days": [1, 3, 4, 7]`
            *   If no change is made, after updating standup it will still be `"days": [1, 3, 4, 7].`
    *   staticTime
        *   To state whether to have reminders send out conformed to each user's timezone or based off the UTC time. **By default** **not specified means it will not be updated and still hold the previous value**.
    *   schedules
        *   Only up to 3 reminders can be scheduled per standup. **By default** **not specified means no current reminders scheduled time will be added/updated and it will still hold the previous value**.

This request updates a particular standup with the additional "reminders" field.

**Optional fields:**

*   **In "standup" body, "reminders" field;**
    *   days
        *   The days in the week to send out reminders. This is specified in the "reminders" field in "standup" body. **By default** **not specified means it will not be updated and still hold the previous value**.
        *   For example :
            *   If before updating standup, the`"days": [1, 3, 4, 7]`
            *   If no change is made, after updating standup it will still be `"days": [1, 3, 4, 7].`
    *   staticTime
        *   To state whether to have reminders send out conformed to each user's timezone or based off the UTC time. **By default** **not specified means it will not be updated and still hold the previous value**.
    *   schedules
        *   Only up to 3 reminders can be scheduled per standup. **By default** **not specified means no current reminders scheduled time will be added/updated and it will still hold the previous value**.
        *   Passing in the form of `{"schedule": [{"time": {"hour": , "min": }}]}` means to set a new reminder.
        *   Params:
            *   "schedule" -
                *   "hour" - number, `0 - 23`
                *   "min" - number, `0 - 59`
        *   For example;
            *   `"reminders": {"schedules": [{ "time": { "hour": 9, "min": 45 } }]}`
            *   Means to add a new reminder 9:45 a.m.

``` json
{
    "standup": {
        ...
        "reminders": {
            "schedules": [{ "time": { "hour": 9, "min": 45 } }]
        }
    }
}

```

This request updates a particular standup with the additional "reminders" field.

**Optional fields:**

*   **In "standup" body, "reminders" field;**
    *   days
        *   The days in the week to send out reminders. This is specified in the "reminders" field in "standup" body. **By default** **not specified means it will not be updated and still hold the previous value**.
        *   For example :
            *   If before updating standup, the`"days": [1, 3, 4, 7]`
            *   If no change is made, after updating standup it will still be `"days": [1, 3, 4, 7].`
    *   staticTime
        *   To state whether to have reminders send out conformed to each user's timezone or based off the UTC time. **By default** **not specified means it will not be updated and still hold the previous value**.
    *   schedules
        *   Only up to 3 reminders can be scheduled per standup. **By default** **not specified means no current reminders scheduled time will be added/updated and it will still hold the previous value**.
        *   Passing in the form of `{"schedule": [{"_id": , "time": {"hour": , "min": }}]}` means to update an existing reminder.
        *   Params:
            *   "schedule" -
                *   "hour" - number, `0 - 23`
                *   "min" - number, `0 - 59`
        *   For example;
            *   `"reminders": {"schedules": [{"_id": "623b7b8d223136e2f040fb2d", "time": {"hour": 10, "min": 20}}]}`
            *   This updates a reminder with the id of "`623b7b8d223136e2f040fb2d`" to 10:20 a.m.

``` json
{
    "standup": {
        ...
        "reminders": {
            "schedules": [{"_id": "623b7b8d223136e2f040fb2d", "time": {"hour": 10, "min": 20}}]
        }
    },
}

```

item.name: Update Standup with new and existing reminders

request.description:
This request updates a particular standup with the additional "reminders" field.

**Optional fields:**

*   **In "standup" body, "reminders" field;**
    *   days
        *   The days in the week to send out reminders. This is specified in the "reminders" field in "standup" body. **By default** **not specified means it will not be updated and still hold the previous value**.
        *   For example :
            *   If before updating standup, the`"days": [1, 3, 4, 7]`
            *   If no change is made, after updating standup it will still be `"days": [1, 3, 4, 7].`
    *   staticTime
        *   To state whether to have reminders send out conformed to each user's timezone or based off the UTC time. **By default** **not specified means it will not be updated and still hold the previous value**.
    *   schedules
        *   Only up to 3 reminders can be scheduled per standup. **By default** **not specified means no current reminders scheduled time will be added/updated and it will still hold the previous value**.
        *   Passing in the form of `{"schedule": [{"time": {"hour": , "min": }}]}` means to set a new reminder.
        *   Passing in the form of `{"schedule": [{"_id": , "time": {"hour": , "min": }}]}` means to update an existing reminder.
        *   Params:
            *   "schedule" -
                *   "hour" - number, `0 - 23`
                *   "min" - number, `0 - 59`
        *   For example;
            *   `"reminders": {"schedules": [{"_id": "622f75ff8ba2365780cd28c1", "time": {"hour": 8, "min": 40}}, {"time": { "hour": 9, "min": 40} }]}`
            *   This sets a reminder at 9:40 a.m. and updates a reminder with the id of "`622f75ff8ba2365780cd28c1`" to 8:40 a.m.

``` json
{
    "standup": {
        ...
        "reminders": {
            "schedules": [{"_id": "622f75ff8ba2365780cd28c1", "time": {"hour": 8, "min": 40}}, {"time": {"hour": 9, "min": 40}}]
         }
    },
}

```

If there is any existing users associated with this standup, it will be removed from their list of "standups" field.

This request updates the user "standups" particular field to contain the standup_id specified.

This request updates the user "standups" particular field to remove the standup_id specified.

If the standup user subscribed to contains reminders, it will remove the reminder that is scheduled for the user.
